title.narrative: PROTECTION OP 3 - PREVENTION AND BEHAVIOR CHANGE

description.narrative: By 2023, children, parents and communities in target regions, in development and humanitarian settings are sensitized on social and gender norms and behaviors that are supportive of a child's right to protection from harm and prevention of gender-based violence, which contributes to Access To Justice, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, girls and boys in Madagascar, particularly the most vulnerable, are better protected from violence, exploitation, abuse, neglect and child marriage

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
